report.title: Walking the Path of Bliss - Briefly
report.author: Genshed
report.bodytext: This was an experiment. /n /n At approximately 9:00 p.m., I prepared the liquids. /n Two tablespoons each of commercial kava kava extract, /n homemade marijuana tincture, and absinthe. This mixture /n was put in the freezer to chill. At approximately 9:30, /n I removed it from the freezer and added as much cold /n sparkling water as the total mixture. It turned an opaque, /n swirling greenish color - the fabled louche of absinthe. /n I downed it in one gulp. The aftertaste was not as /n unpleasant as expected - the bitterness of absinthe with /n sweet anise overtones. /n /n I was at home, relaxed, with no pressing concerns. By /n 10:00 p.m., I was the only one still up. My lips were /n beginning to feel numb, the sign that the kava was taking /n effect. I was feeling slightly numb in my extremities. /n By 10:15 p.m., I was feeling quite good - even more relaxed, /n optimistic and peaceful. I set up my Dreamachine (a homemade /n device that produces light flickers in the low alpha range). /n I then smoked a small bowl of high-grade marijuana. As /n it began to take effect, I sat down at the Dreamachine. /n /n The visual effects came on quite rapidly. The initial /n entoptic imagery gave way to a ceaseless kaleidoscopic /n array of color, shape and light, reminiscent of some /n accounts I've read of mescaline's effects. I began to /n see clear images within the swirling vortex, forming, /n rising up to full prominence, then being sucked down and /n replaced with new ones. My spirit soared as I began to /n see _through_ the vortex, into a calm and glowing level /n marked by a stable geometrical pattern. It appeared to be /n hexagonal, in glowing green and yellow - although colors /n such that I've never seen with mortal eyes. /n /n After some ten or twelve minutes of this rapt contemplation /n of the fiery fractal mandala that lies on the other side of /n darkness, I got up, went to the couch and laid down. Immediately /n upon closing my eyes, I began to see closed eye visuals (CEVs). /n These morphed and transformed as inexorably as the ones /n before. After settling in and becoming quite comfortable, /n I took up a whipped cream dispenser, exhaled, and took in /n a moderate lungful of nitrous oxide. /n /n As I exhaled, I could tell the sensation of air passing /n through my trachea had already changed. Inhale, exhale. . . /n and my body began to experience Pure Pleasure. I felt myself /n ascending the World Tree and emerging into the brilliance /n of the Living World. Every joy and pleasure of mortal life /n was a mere shadow or gossamer simulacrum of this experience. /n Even as I soared above the canopy into the clear blue beyond, /n I knew that gravity was pulling me back. A long long descent /n back to my body, where simply being stoned out of my gourd /n felt like being stone cold sober by contrast. /n /n I put everything away, brushed my teeth, took two ibuprofen, /n drank a glass of water, and went to bed. Got up seven hours /n later feeling fine. /n /n Do NOT attempt this if you are going to be in public. /n /n I intend to repeat this experiment, but not soon and not /n very often. It was an extreme experience.
